During all the experiment, time and temperature are critical. All the steps have to be performed at +4°C if not otherwise stated. Pre-cool all the centrifuges and rotors.


An overview of the protocol is shown in Figure

body.body: Collect embryos at the one-cell stage in a 35 mm Petri dish with E3 medium \(100 embryos per condition at least).
Place the embryos at the expected developmental stage into a pre-chilled dounce glass and add 1 ml of ice-cold MB buffer.

Homogenize for 10 times in ice with a loose-fitting pestle by slowly stroking the pestle up and down until all embryo’s chorions are removed. This step also permits to disrupt the yolk sac of the embryos.
Let the homogenate settle on ice for 10 minutes.
Transfer the homogenate into a pre-chilled 1.5 ml microcentrifuge tube and centrifuge at 300 _g_ for 5 min.
An optional additional centrifugation step can be added. Re-spin the supernatant at 300 _g_ for 5 min to pellet any cells left.
Resuspend pellet containing the cells with 1 ml of cold-MB buffer.
Disrupt the cells with a 1 mL syringe and a 26 G x 2/3 needle 50 times on ice.

Homogenization can be checked by placing 2 µl on a microscope slide and visualizing cell lysis by phase-contrast microscopy. Few intact cells must be visible, if it is not the case re-disrupt homogenate until all the cells are lysed.
Centrifuge cell lysate twice at 1,500 _g_ for 10 min to eliminate nuclei.
Transfer the supernatant containing mitochondria, cytosol and microsomes into a new pre-chilled 1.5 ml centrifuge tube.
Spin the supernatant twice at 10,600 _g_ for 10 min to pellet mitochondria \(labeled as mito-I).
Remove and store supernatant on ice \(labeled as ER-I) for endoplasmic reticulum membranes isolation.
Gently resuspend the mito-I pellet with 1 ml of cold MB buffer.
Centrifuge again at 10,600 _g_ for 10 min.
Discard the supernatant and save the pellet as mitochondria.
Gently resuspend mitochondria in 50 µl of cold MB buffer.
Determine the protein concentration of the sample \(Bradford).
Store at -20°C for further investigations \(western blot) if not used immediately.

Spin at 100,000 _g_ for 1 hour at +4°C.
The pellet is not visible so carefully discard the supernatant and gently resuspend the pellet containing ER membrane in 50 µl of cold MB buffer.
The amount of microsome proteins is determined \(Bradford).
Store at -20°C for further investigations \(western blot) if not used immediately.

body: Wash twice the mitochondrial pellet mito-I \(from step

body.body: with 1 ml of fresh cold KCL medium.
Centrifuge 10 min at 10,600 _g_ at +4°C.
Determine the amount of mitochondrial proteins \(Bradford).
Transfer 75 µg of proteins into a new 1.5 ml centrifuge tube and adjust volume to 1 ml with KCL medium.
Centrifuge 10 min at 10,600 _g_ at +4°C.
Gently resuspend the pellet with 180 µl of KCL medium containing 1 μM of the cytosolic calcium probe OregonGreen 5N.
Transfer all the volume in a well of a black 96-well plate with flat and transparent bottom.
OregonGreen 5N fluorescence intensity is measured using a Mithras LB 940 multimode microplate reader with excitation at 485 nm and emission at 510 nm.
Fluorescence intensity is measured every 2 s for 5 min.
After 30 s measurement, 20 µl of KCL buffer supplemented with 200 µM CaCl<sub>2</sub> is injected \(final concentration of CaCl<sub>2</sub> 20 µM).
The decrease of fluorescence intensity following the peak induced by CaCl<sub>2</sub> injection is representative of the mitochondrial calcium uptake.
